title: Fed Officials Continued to Discuss Benefits of a Standing Repo Facility at June Meeting
sub_head: Most central bankers said the potential benefits of such a facility outweighed the potential costs, FOMC meeting minutes show
body:
Federal Reserve officials are continuing to work toward the possible launch of a facility that would help big banks and possibly others manage financial liquidity in times of stress, but how exactly it would operate is far from settled.
Policy makers once again weighed the creation of a standing repo facility at their June 15-16 Federal Open Market Committee meeting, minutes released Wednesday show. Such a tool would allow eligible financial firms to quickly and easily hand over securities, most likely government bonds, for...
